decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly getting creatures on the board to deal damage and trigger abilities, while also disrupting the opponent with counterspells and removal. The key strategy is to use cards like Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow and Ornithopter to get in evasive attacks and draw cards, while utilizing cards like Ingenious Infiltrator and Changeling Outcast to keep a consistent flow of creatures on the board. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Daze, Force of Will, and Force of Negation to control the game and protect its own threats.

The deck focuses on control through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. It utilizes a mix of versatile threats like Uro and Snapcaster Mage, along with powerful cards like Punishing Fire and Leovold to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion adds additional value and consistency to the deck, allowing for more flexibility in longer games. The mana base is carefully constructed to support a variety of colors while also providing access to powerful lands like Karakas and Grove of the Burnwillows.

The main focus of this Legacy 1 vs 1 aggro deck is to control the board using disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze, while maintaining a steady stream of threats with cards like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist. The deck aims to quickly pressure the opponent's life total with efficient creatures and burn spells like Lightning Bolt, while also providing card advantage through cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns adds versatility to the deck, while the mana base allows for consistent access to different colors of mana for optimal spellcasting.

This deck aims to assemble the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's library and win the game. To facilitate this combo, the deck includes tools such as Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer to tutor for the pieces, along with disruption in the form of Pyroblast and Lightning Bolt. Karn, the Great Creator can also shut down opponent's artifacts while providing additional utility. The deck utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, while also disrupting opponent's mana base with Blood Moon and Trinisphere.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to apply early pressure on opponents. It also incorporates disruptive elements like Collector Ouphe and Skyclave Apparition to disrupt opposing strategies. The deck leverages powerful cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Green Sun's Zenith to generate advantage and close out games quickly. With a mix of ramp, removal, and card advantage, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a proactive game plan while also disrupting their key plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing enchantments to generate card advantage and lock down the opponent's resources. By ramping with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Wild Growth, and drawing cards with Enchantress effects, the deck aims to assemble a powerful board state while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Elephant Grass and Energy Field. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents for extra triggers. The deck aims to control the game until it can win with a large Shark Typhoon or lock the opponent out with Words of Wind.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands as a control strategy, using cards like Life from the Loam and Crop Rotation to manipulate the battlefield. It also includes a mix of lands with different abilities, such as Valakut Exploration for card advantage and Dark Depths for a potential win condition. The deck is designed to disrupt the opponent's game plan by destroying their lands with cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter, while also having the ability to generate advantage through its land interactions.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 combo deck focuses on quickly getting out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield using Show and Tell. Utilizing ramp creatures like Chancellor of the Annex and Elvish Spirit Guide, along with cascade spells like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst, the deck aims to cheat out big threats ahead of schedule. With access to counter spells like Force of Will and Misdirection for protection, the deck's goal is to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on using Cloudpost lands and ramp spells to quickly assemble a powerful mana base, allowing for the casting of enormous threats such as Emrakul and Ulamog. The deck also includes cards like Primeval Titan and Golos to further accelerate mana generation and search for key pieces of the combo. Pithing Needle and Reclamation Sage help disrupt opponents' strategies while cards like Crop Rotation and Expedition Map help tutor for essential lands. The deck's strategy revolves around quickly ramping up mana and overwhelming opponents with massive threats.

The primary objective of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost lands and artifacts like Grim Monolith, to play powerful colorless creatures like Karn, Scion of Urza and Thought-Knot Seer. It also aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere, while utilizing cards like Karn, the Great Creator to search for additional artifacts and shut down opposing strategies. The deck has a strong focus on generating mana and using it to play impactful threats and disrupt opponents' game plans.

The strategy of this deck revolves around quickly assembling the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token, which can close out the game in just a few turns. The deck includes a mix of cards to help find and protect the combo pieces, such as Sylvan Scrying, Crop Rotation, and Pithing Needle. Additionally, disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress can help clear the way for the combo to go off smoothly, while cards like Stifle and Not of This World provide additional protection against removal and disruption from the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset, Parter of Veils, as well as counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. The strategy revolves around using Standstill to slow down the game and prevent opponents from advancing their board state, while also utilizing powerful card draw spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to find key cards. The inclusion of cards like Supreme Verdict and Moat helps maintain board control, while Shark Typhoon provides a win condition in the late game. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Karakas and Mystic Sanctuary.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of goblins, utilizing cards like Goblin Lackey to put powerful creatures into play for free. The deck also includes cards like Munitions Expert and Sling-Gang Lieutenant to deal direct damage to the opponent while maintaining board presence. Additionally, the deck has a few control elements such as Goblin Cratermaker and Reanimate to deal with threats from the opponent. The deck's mana base is efficient and includes cards like Aether Vial to help get goblins onto the battlefield quickly.

The deck focuses on playing powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly and disrupting opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. It also utilizes mana acceleration cards like Grim Monolith and Simian Spirit Guide to cast threats ahead of schedule. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive creatures and disrupt their game plan with a combination of hand disruption and lock pieces like Karn, the Great Creator. The mana base includes lands like Ancient Tomb and Cavern of Souls to ensure smooth mana development for the Eldrazi creatures.

The deck revolves around utilizing lands as both resources and disruption, using cards like Life from the Loam and Exploration to ramp and recur lands like Dark Depths and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale. Crop Rotation and Elvish Reclaimer help find key lands quickly, while cards like Spreading Algae and Wasteland disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to control the game through land-based strategies, using powerful lands like Maze of Ith and Rishadan Port to control the board while setting up for powerful win conditions like Thespian's Stage and Dark Depths combo.

The key concept of this deck is utilizing the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard with creatures, enabling powerful combos and graveyard-based plays. By dredging cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, the deck can quickly amass creatures like Narcomoeba and Ichorid to create a strong board presence. The deck also includes cards like Faithless Looting and Cabal Therapy to further manipulate the graveyard. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with creatures from the graveyard, setting up for a game-winning combo or explosive finish.
